channel.title: Learning PHP! Advice & Help?
channel.description:
[size=7pt]Firstly, if this isn't the right section for this or something, someone let me know ;][/size]
[size=20pt]Learning PHP[/size] Two words, which 2 years ago, wouldn't even cross my mind. Over the past few years I've been introduced to the world of computers, and they're something I'm keen to do well in in life.
Since I started becoming really engrosed in computers I've learned 2 languages fluently, HTML and CSS. CSS was probably my favourite. But, to learn these two, I didn't do anything by the book, I just followed TUT's, improvised, and taught myself, and to be honest, I don't think it should have taken as long as it did. I've realised that PHP is going to be neccessary if I want to carry on in the design/web development field of computers. I've also realised that it's also alot more technical that CSS and HTML. I've had a little bit of experience in Java, but nothing too serious.
To be honest, I'm posting here for advice and help. I've been reading tutorials, books etc. And I think I've got to grips with the basics etc, but I need some help!
[b]A few questions I need answering![/b]
[ul][li]Where do I begin?![/li] [li]Is there any [i]really[/i] tut sites etc?[/li] [li]Roughly, how long will I need to be learning to become advanced/fluent?[/li] [li]Is there any good ways of learning which won't get tedious? [/li][/ul]
Any help is appreciated! :D
-[b]JV[/b]

item.description:

[quote=“xxlegitxx, post:27, topic:169172”][quote author=xX00java00Xx link=topic=228850.msg1977648#msg1977648 date=1199528106]
Lol?.. have you even used it?.. Errr i don’t think so… and I wasn’t talking about HTML… I was talking about Java and JavaScrip. Java being about 5 times harder than HTML… I just don’t have the time to worry about learning it when there are programs that will make the website with out any codeing needed. I focus all my skills on Java and some JavaScript. Mostly Java thogh. And yes it does work according tot the fact I learned Java purely off of books… No tutorials were used. I just read the books… Hmmm… So maby we should think before we post?.. Wow what an idea… To actualy think?.. Hmmm…

PS: Thinking works wonders!!! Try it!
[/quote]

FIVE TIMES HARDER, JV, FIVE TIMES![/quote]

I heard I ought to think before I post.
But seriosuly, does anybody know any good wysiwyg editors which require no coding experience? I really need help

item.title: Learning PHP! Advice & Help?
item.dc:creator: @ThatOneServer Mike_
item.description:
@ThatOneServer wrote:

Whenever you want to do something you don’t know how to do, Google it. I personally click Tizag links first when they are given from Google, but never go to the site directly.

Once you find an EXAMPLE of what you want(such as a SQL select), copy and paste it into your source. Then delete the bulk of the code, and put what you want in there.

Lets say you Google “Search SQL”.
it gives you a result with(delete red, change blue):

<? if(isset($_GET['npc'])) { $mysql = mysql_query("SELECT * FROM uber3_npcs WHERE name LIKE '%".$_GET['npc']."%'") or die(mysql_error()); while($row = mysql_fetch_assoc($mysql)){ echo ''; } } ?>

Doing this would be the same as finding a tutorial that shows you a form/search code. This is not ‘leeching’ because if you looked up each part one by one, it would end up like this.

'.$row['id'].' '.$row['name'].'

Read full topic

item.title: Learning PHP! Advice & Help?
item.dc:creator: @JV1 JV
item.description:
@JV1 wrote:

[quote=“Pwnd, post:21, topic:169172”][quote author=xxlegitxx link=topic=228850.msg1964577#msg1964577 date=1199073470]
w3schools is where I learned everything. Their examples, coupled with Dreamweaver’s auto-upload function, made learning all the web languages I know easy.
[/quote]It’s where I started, anyhow

I just bought a book that I have to start getting into. I know a good amount of it without actually having to learn the language, but I guess a book will solidify my foundation a bit moar.[/quote]

xxlegitxx:

Yea, I highly recommend getting a book. This O’Reilly CSS book I got really helped me alot more than any web tutorial.

I’ve bought two books now. One of which is PHP5 For Dummies. I can’t remember the name of the other one

Read full topic

item.description:
@JV1 wrote:

[quote=“Niall, post:19, topic:169172”]I got 2 websites for you,

www.php-mysql-tutorial.com/ If you are in a rush and need to know how to do something quickly.

http://www.w3schools.com/php/default.asp If you really want to learn the language. (It’s probably already been mentioned - I didn’t bother reading the thread. :p)[/quote]

Thanks for the first one
I’m currentlyy using the w3schools one.
Thanks alottt.

I r knowin’ wot concatenations r!

-JV

item.title: Learning PHP! Advice & Help?
item.dc:creator: @JV1 JV
item.description:
@JV1 wrote:

[quote=“sppt, post:17, topic:169172”][quote author=JV link=topic=228850.msg1967821#msg1967821 date=1199165864]

i would STRONGLY suggest buying a book or two, but if you dont want to buy a book then id reccomend php.net or w3schools.com.

I bought ‘PHP5 for Dummies’ today. It was 7£ so it’s really not a problem if it’s not a great book, but has anybody read it?

-JV
[/quote]
i didn’t, but the book i read, basiscursus php5 (a dutch book), was pretty good.
so i wouldn’t say that all books are bad ;)[/quote]

Oh I suppose that’s okay then. Cause I was wondering if PHP5 was the right one to choose.
Thanks man. I’ll look that one up too
-JV

Read full topic
